pageContext.claim: “Oh, I have an appetite for background checks [for gun sales]. We're going to be doing background checks. We're working with Democrats. We're working with Republicans. … So what happens is -- with background checks, we're dealing with Democrats, we're dealing with Republicans, we're dealing with the NRA, we're dealing with gun owners. We're dealing with everybody. And I think we're going to have something, hopefully, that's meaningful.”
pageContext.analysis: When political pressure rises for tighter gun controls, typically after a mass shooting, Trump usually says he's interested in strengthening federal requirements for background checks. But he invariably abandons those plans later on.
